{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fetal alcohol syndrome is characterized by several features. According to Document [3], it is characterized by slower physical growth, distinct facial abnormalities including smooth philtrum, thin vermilion, and short palpebral fissures, neurological deficits, or smaller head circumference. Document [26] also mentions microcephaly, short palpebral fissures, an underdeveloped philtrum and a thin upper lip as notable features. Document [14] mentions growth retardation, mental retardation, neurologic dysfunction and congenital dysmorphology. Document [26] also mentions mental retardation as a common and serious deficit. Document [26] also mentions atrial and ventricular septal defects. However, none of the documents mention a large proportionate body as a characteristic of fetal alcohol syndrome. In fact, growth retardation is commonly mentioned.", "answer_choice": "C"}
